description: Physiotherapy is an evidence-based healthcare profession that views human movement as central to health and wellbeing.
Sports Medicine can be one of the most effective treatments of any muscles, joints, ligaments, and tendon related injuries.
Podiatry is the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of all foot and lower limb conditions, injury and care needs.
Pilates is a gentle form of exercise which improves posture, flexibility, and core strength. It was originally developed in the 1920â€™s by Joseph Pilates.
Remedial massage is a natural therapy that focuses on specific pressure and manipulation of the muscular system to promote rehabilitation and relaxation.
Dietetics is the science of diet, food and nutrition, and the role they play in overall health.
